guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Be respectful and considerate in your interactions. This is important to maintain a welcoming atmosphere in the project community.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report issues using the provided templates and provide detailed information. Clear and structured issue reports help in addressing problems efficiently.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests with clear descriptions and necessary tests. Providing thorough details and validations helps in efficient code reviews and integration.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Follow the specified coding standards and style guidelines. Consistent coding practices ensure readability and maintainability of the codebase.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update documentation alongside code changes. Keeping documentation up-to-date is crucial for users and contributors to understand the project's functionality and usage.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback. Collaborative code reviews help in maintaining code quality and collective learning.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write and run tests to validate your code changes. Ensuring that new features and bug fixes are tested prevents regressions and maintains stability.

guidelines.title: Branch Management
guidelines.description: Use descriptive branch names and follow branching strategies. Organized branching helps in managing different development stages and features effectively.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and concise commit messages. Informative commit messages facilitate tracking changes and understanding the project history.

guidelines.title: Contribution Scope
guidelines.description: Ensure your contributions align with the project goals and roadmap. Aligning with the project's objectives helps in coherent development and avoids redundant efforts.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Maintain consistency in code style by following the project's code style guidelines. This ensures readability and maintainability of the codebase.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and concise commit messages. Good commit messages facilitate code review and tracking of changes.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests with a clear title and detailed description of the changes. Properly documented pull requests make it easier for maintainers to review and merge contributions.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report issues by filling out the issue template with as much detail as possible. Detailed issue reports help maintainers quickly understand and address the problem.

guidelines.title: Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews by providing constructive feedback. Code reviews are essential for maintaining code quality and sharing knowledge within the community.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write tests for new features and bug fixes to ensure code reliability. Testing helps catch issues early and ensures that the code works as expected.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Contribute to and maintain project documentation. Comprehensive documentation helps new developers get up to speed and makes it easier to use the project.

guidelines.title: Respectful Communication
guidelines.description: Engage in respectful and professional communication with other contributors. Positive communication fosters a collaborative and inclusive community.
